intro: Matricaria chamomilla var. recutita, commonly known as German chamomile, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features finely divided, silver-white, hairy leaves and yellow flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant is typically grown for its aromatic flowers, which are used in teas and traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often reaching a height of 30 to 60 centimeters. The essential oil extracted from its flowers contains compounds like bisabolol and chamazulene, which are valued for their anti-inflammatory and calming properties.
